author: Q U A S A R
title: ESUSU: MicroInsurance Nigeria
description: Access to many types of insurance in Nigeria is not available and unaffordable.

assessments.note: This project aim to meet a required need in the largest country (population) in Africa. Success here could then be rolled out to the rest of the continent. It would drive adoption of Cardano in Africa if successful.
Microinsurance protocols in the Cardano blockchain are a important usecase.

The availability of insurance products on blockchain will be a proof of concept for major adaptation. There is a large scope to leverage the blockchain for insurance processing. However, there are a large number of uncertainties, risks, and regulatory compliance requirements.

The proposal addresses the Fund 5: Grow Africa, Grow Cardano challenge. It addresses How Cardano can reach more people in Africa by offering insurance products to Nigerians. This project, if implemented well, will bring more users to the Cardano ecosystem and Atala Prism identity when onboarding new insurance clients.
The proposers have relevant experience, however this is not a small project, thus it is hard to agree two people can implement it successfully.
There is a lack of senior members with blockchain development experience.

The teams experience seams sufficient to the task. The budget seams reasonable. But the overall plan seams off to me. The challenges seam to me not really thought out. The challenge of building an insurance on top of the blockchain is very big. So the team might be up to it but that is not clear.

The proposal has set an enormous scope, from regulatory approvals, development of risk models, and overcoming of technical challenges. The proposer claims eighteen years of experience. However, there will be a requirement for a large team to handle the complete process.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because the project plan is well done, and the team has experience in the Nigerian financial market.

More information is required on the feasibility of this project. It would also be good to understand how they will address the cost issue involved in claims validation which is inherently a high touch business to avoid fraud. No mention is made of how the entity will invest premiums and how this risk will be managed which is a large part of a successful insurance business.
All the details of the plan are there. Plus information on the people behind it.
The challenges of building an insurance on top of the Cardano blockchain and how they are going to be met is not really clear.

Progress can be audited, but it is difficult to measure the chance of sucess with the available date. The status of regulatory clearance and the policy of the Nigerian government toward crypto-based insurance will be a major hurdle. However, there is a reason to try this experiment, at least for trailblazing purposes.
The roadmap is clear and provides an in-depth, step-by-step action plan, making this project easier to audit.

solution: We are building micro-insurance products that are affordable, accessible, and needed.
experience: 18 years working with global carriers, and 8 years in Financial Services in Nigeria.
